Articles.Content:
Not sure if this is actually a FAR issue/solution, but I have been having constant yellow slow mode issues. I Decided to have a look at the console and seeing constant part voxelization spam related to the new circular panels. Same behavior with small and big crafts. 

Solution: I went to settings from main menu and turned off "verbose logging". Voilà, massive crafts launch smoothly and only occasionally flash yellow. Haven't yet checked real numbers, but launches seem proceed at about double (mission time vs. real time elapsed). Console also seems to  be clear of spurious messages.

So the lesson is try to remember to turn off debugging tools once the mods are playing nicely and no longer needed.

So it seems like my game doesn't have any aerodynamics at all. I think it worked fine earlier.

I downloaded some basic mods for the latest 1.12.2 version and then tested the game. It worked just fine and FAR was one of those mods. After a few hours I downloaded a whole bunch of other mods and tried testing it again. It seemed to be working fine until I started reentry and realized I wasn't slowing down at all! The reentry heat was there, my ablator was tearing up just like normal but I had no drag. So I tested launching an airplane and this is what I found out with the F12 overlay:

No drag, no lift, nothing...

So before I start digging through GameData for hours I thought I'd ask if there's any known incompatibility that may cause this. This is my mod folder:

Edited September 3, 2021 by lodiped

17 hours ago, lodiped said:

 

So before I start digging through GameData for hours I thought I'd ask if there's any known incompatibility that may cause this. This is my mod folder:

It is hard to tell for me just on the first sight if there is something wrong. It seems to be fine, however, it is always possible that some 3rd party moded parts does not have proper FAR data for wings (similar thing happened with APP mod in past, you can look back in this tread for more info abut it). You can find somewhere buried in this thread custom MM patch that marks incomplete parts for FAR if you already don't have this.

You have "Custom_FARAeroData.cfg" file, though, that is unknown what it does. KSP.log file may reveal much more what went wrong. It will be much easier for anyone to help you with log file.

On 9/3/2021 at 4:04 PM, kcs123 said:

You have "Custom_FARAeroData.cfg" file, though, that is unknown what it does. KSP.log file may reveal much more what went wrong. It will be much easier for anyone to help you with log file.

 

wait so I'm not supposed to have this "Custom_FARAeroData.cfg" in my folder?

10 hours ago, lodiped said:

wait so I'm not supposed to have this "Custom_FARAeroData.cfg" in my folder?

Well, there is "CustomFARAeroData.cfg" within "FerramAerospaceResearch" folder that is shiped with FAR. You have "Custom_FARAeroData.cfg" file in main GameData folder that is certainly not shiped with FAR. Note a slightly different file name.

You got this file most probably from some other mod, I can only guess. Should you need that file or not, depends what is written in that file. It might be that some mod require it, but also may be a case of badly written patch that cause your issues. Hard to tell just from picture.

EDIT:

Well, it would more precise answer that there was "CustomFARAeroData.cfg" within "FerramAerospaceResearch" folder with older FAR versions. I don't know if it is shiped with latest releases or it is maybe autogenerated on the first run of KSP with FAR. I no longer recall and can't check with latest KSP, so take that with grain of salt. But, I'm 99% certain that your file in gamedata folder is not part of official FAR.

Edited September 5, 2021 by kcs123

5 hours ago, kcs123 said:

I don't know much about how FAR works but could these numbers mean much in relation to the "no drag" situation I mentioned?

3 hours ago, lodiped said:

This is what's in it:

(snip)

I don't know much about how FAR works but could these numbers mean much in relation to the "no drag" situation I mentioned?

That looks like legit FAR config file, but for some reason is in unusual folder. I can only guess (and probably others) what is happening without log files. It could be conflict with other FAR config files and cause issues. Without logs that can tell much more what is going on, you can try to delete that file, uninstall FAR, delete "FerramAerospaceResearch" folder and install FAR again. If that does not help, provide log file, so that someone be able to help you.

This Mod causes me to not be able to enter VAB/SPH, 

I don't know If anyone is getting this problem but this mod causes me to no be able to enter the VAB /SPH or launch directly from the runway or pad from the screen you first load into the game.

I can also enter the astronaut complex but I cant exit it. I have this mod installed using CKAN, I have 70 mods installed on CKAN and have narrowed it down to this one,

I want to use this mod because its apart of realism overhaul, although for now I have to manually remove this mod from the GameData folder.  Im also running the latest version of KSP   1.12.2

I have also verified the intergrity of the game files many times and for some reason there are always some files that are missing and need to be replaced after playing the game, although I dont think its anything critical.   

Any ideas?

And Im also wondering if this mod is even nessesarry anymore because the game had received updates when it comes to aerodynamics.

Edit: I also uninstalled realism overhaul because It changed the size of many parts when I would rather change it to a realistic size with tweakscale so Im not planning to use FAR anymore even if the problem gets resolved.

Edited September 9, 2021 by Pennywise9492

On 9/5/2021 at 3:51 PM, kcs123 said:

That looks like legit FAR config file, but for some reason is in unusual folder. I can only guess (and probably others) what is happening without log files. It could be conflict with other FAR config files and cause issues. Without logs that can tell much more what is going on, you can try to delete that file, uninstall FAR, delete "FerramAerospaceResearch" folder and install FAR again. If that does not help, provide log file, so that someone be able to help you.

Just an update: I deleted the mod and that particular cfg file and played a little with stock aero. The next day I reinstalled FAR and it just worked. I tried replicating the flight I noticed the bug but I wasn't able to. So... yeah. Weird but alright, it's perfect now.

5 hours ago, Pennywise9492 said:

I don't know If anyone is getting this problem but this mod causes me to no be able to enter the VAB /SPH or launch directly from the runway or pad from the screen you first load into the game.

I can also enter the astronaut complex but I cant exit it. I have this mod installed using CKAN, I have 70 mods installed on CKAN and have narrowed it down to this one,

I want to use this mod because its apart of realism overhaul, although for now I have to manually remove this mod from the GameData folder.  Im also running the latest version of KSP   1.12.2

I have also verified the intergrity of the game files many times and for some reason there are always some files that are missing and need to be replaced after playing the game, although I dont think its anything critical.   

Any ideas?

And Im also wondering if this mod is even nessesarry anymore because the game had received updates when it comes to aerodynamics.

Just came here to post that I am having the exact same issue. 

 

I install it, and start up a new sandbox game and cannot enter the VAB or SPH. I quit, uninstall FAR, and then start a new sandbox game and everything is fine. Quit again, and install FAR again to doublecheck and I can't enter the VAB or SPH. 

 

Before I do any serious digging I figured I would first post about this to see if anybody else has experienced it. I definitely didn't have the issue in KSP 1.11. 

 

Also, this is a completely fresh install of KSP. When I decided to finally move to the latest version, I installed it and then went and installed all of my mods over again, confirming compatibility first of each of them with 1.12.

 

 

Edited September 9, 2021 by Hudsonkm

So.... Was looking at the debugger, and eventually saw something which led me to try uninstalling Kronometer. Restarted the game and could once again enter the VAB and SPH, and leave the astronaut complex. The problem did not happen when Kronometer was installed WITHOUT FAR, but the two of them together at least in my case seemed to be causing the issue.  These strange FAR toolbar errors only would happen in my install when both are installed.  Once I uninstalled Kronometer I didn't see these errors in the console.

I am not even sure if these errors should even be causing the problem? Somebody that knows more about this may have a better idea of what is going on. These errors do not show when I click on VAB or SPH and try to enter but cant. They pop up when I enter the astronaut complex and try to leave back to the KSC.

But yeah, they only show up with both Kronometer and FAR installed... At least in my case.

 

 

Edited September 9, 2021 by Hudsonkm

18 hours ago, Pennywise9492 said:

 

I don't know If anyone is getting this problem but this mod causes me to no be able to enter the VAB /SPH or launch directly from the runway or pad from the screen you first load into the game.

 

14 hours ago, Hudsonkm said:

Just came here to post that I am having the exact same issue. 

Check previous page. Most likely you don't have Toolbar controler properly installed. Double check if you have all dependency properly installed.

If that does not help, provide log files, it is hard to help anyone without it.

21 minutes ago, kcs123 said:

 

Check previous page. Most likely you don't have Toolbar controler properly installed. Double check if you have all dependency properly installed.

If that does not help, provide log files, it is hard to help anyone without it.

 

Alright will try that! TY for the info.

Edited September 9, 2021 by Hudsonkm

Ferram Aerospace Research v0.16.0.4 "Mader"

Fixed NREs with potatoroids, thanks @simmav #127
Added massOverride to FARWingAerodynamicModel that fixes the module mass to the set value, with thanks to @StoneSmile #126

Hello,

I have built a stock replica of a Bf 109. It flies fantastic, however, I want to test it out with realistic aerodynamics. My airplane relies heavily on KAL-1000 to automatically adjust trim and to spin up the engine in a realistic manner. When I install FAR, my code for elevon deploy angle and RPM/Torque for the engine disappears from KAL-1000. Moreover, the option to assign deployment angle to KAL-1000 in the action group menu is not visible, nor is it visible upon right clicking the control surface. When FAR is uninstalled, the code reappears in KAL-1000.

I tried conducting a search regarding this issue, but nothing turned up. Can you help me out please?

On 9/26/2021 at 1:07 PM, LiudvikasLTU said:

Hello,

I have built a stock replica of a Bf 109. It flies fantastic, however, I want to test it out with realistic aerodynamics. My airplane relies heavily on KAL-1000 to automatically adjust trim and to spin up the engine in a realistic manner. When I install FAR, my code for elevon deploy angle and RPM/Torque for the engine disappears from KAL-1000. Moreover, the option to assign deployment angle to KAL-1000 in the action group menu is not visible, nor is it visible upon right clicking the control surface. When FAR is uninstalled, the code reappears in KAL-1000.

I tried conducting a search regarding this issue, but nothing turned up. Can you help me out please?

I'm not a very expert on FAR (I tried in the past, but not using it recently):
if FAR still patches wings, ailerons and aerodynamic parts like in the past, it could be very likely the fact that it removes a lot of the stock "deflecting" modules, change them to its own.

So, with FAR installed, it could be that KAL-1000 cannot recognize the FAR modules related to deflection.
(It's just an educated guess, as said I do not have FAR in my game, recently)

New Realism Overhaul RP1 install following the RO RP1 guide. No additional mods. Atmospheric viscosity seems to have not loaded correctly leading to an absence of drag, lift etc. In game it shows as 0.00002 whereas at 288K it should be more like 1.17894? Ive fed back this issue on the RO thread and let them know Ive done the same here. I used the debug tool to manually adjust viscosity and it works fine now. I mention this in case of others who might have similar issues.

 

Edited October 24, 2021 by Sunscreen

Edited October 23, 2021 by Lightlaw

After uninstalling FAR all options for pitch, yaw, roll have been removed from my game. right clicking on any control surfaces  in VAB/SPH show's no options for Pitch, Yaw or Roll, all evalons act as regular parts with no movement. Tried uninstalling all mods and problems remains. It seems when you remove FAR it takes as much of your game with it as it can.

5 hours ago, M_11 said:

After uninstalling FAR all options for pitch, yaw, roll have been removed from my game. right clicking on any control surfaces  in VAB/SPH show's no options for Pitch, Yaw or Roll, all evalons act as regular parts with no movement. Tried uninstalling all mods and problems remains. It seems when you remove FAR it takes as much of your game with it as it can.

Try removing all the control surfaces from one of your craft (I suggest choosing the simplest!), saving the craft, reloading it, and then replacing the the control surfaces. I know that's a nuisance, but I believe it will fix the problem. (You may find that craft you haven't touched since installing FAR will still be OK.)

(You may be able to edit the craft files using a text editor, but I'd have to look up the changes needed, and I am short on time. Perhaps somebody else could advise?)

Q: Why? A: FAR replaces the stock control-surface modules normally attached to parts in a craft, and replaces them with its own; uninstalling FAR doesn't remove the FAR control-surface modules in existing craft, nor replace them with the stock modules - hence the game can no longer recognize the parts as control surfaces, and the need to replace them with shiny new parts from the parts catologue.

The best way to post logs is to save them to a freebie fileserver, and then post the link. I prefer Dropbox. It gets around that appalling mass of text that can destroy the format of a forum page! OK, you need to sign up for an account, but Dropbox are a pretty responsible company and I have had no issues. The service is free for small-scale users, and as such it's ideal for those of us who occasionally need to send log files!
